snippet: These days in Vicksburg, Miss., the site of a bitter 47-day siege in 1863, it is hard to get many residents to come up with strong feelings about the Civil War at all.
abstract: Vicksburg Journal; among modern-day residents of Vicksburg, Miss, site of bitter 47-day siege in 1863, it is hard to find many with strong feelings about the Civil War; folklore has it that for years, people of Vicksburg did not celebrate Fourth of July holiday because of bitterness over war.
lead_paragraph: These days in Vicksburg, Miss., the site of a bitter 47-day siege in 1863, it is hard to get many residents to come up with strong feelings about the Civil War at all.

headline.main: With Civil War’s Rancor Faded, Reasons to Celebrate
headline.print_headline: With History’s Rancor Faded, Reasons to Celebrate
